posts.post_content: I can respect this cycle. It will never be competitive, but it has it's place with beginners. I only wish it were common instead.

Posted By: Totema (1/7/2012 8:26:09 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: It's quite reasonable that they print this garbage. Yes, it appeals to new players or to ones who can't afford to buy a fully-competetive deck. Not everyone has conditions to play in international tournaments, magic is also played in casual circles, and there are people who don't have enough cards that fit their decks so they fill them with such cards. Besides, worse cards must exist, because they are a point of reference on which you can say which cards are good. And this cycle is uncommon, because of limited. It would cause even more complaints if we were overwhelmed by them during drafts, now we only sometimes run across those cards during drafts. Well, that's just my humble opinion... and sorry for my English.
posts.html:

Posted By: Pacifist013 (8/1/2012 7:06:39 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Bad card is bad.  
If you're putting this in your deck, you're wasting a slot. To get maximum mileage out this card, you'd have to drop it early, instead of summoning a creature or mana ramping, either of which will benefit you much more. The lifegain these things gives is **insignificant** anyway.. In my UG self mill deck, I can easily get 30+ life with just one casting of [Gnaw To The Bone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gnaw To The Bone); not even considering the flashback. Now THATS lifegain.
posts.html:

Posted By: NeoKoda (4/20/2012 4:05:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
What would be a better version of this card:  
  
*Wurm's (something)*  
Legendary Land  
Wurm's (something) enters the battlefield tapped.  
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.  
Whenever a player plays a green spell, you may gain 1 life.  
  
Hey look, I solved your problems. This card gets played, it's legendary so it can't be broken, and it produces mana for the same color that causes you to gain life. Now there's a REASON to *ever* play it.
posts.html:
